\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 6360}

\subsection*{Addicted to methylmorphine}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Alberto}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 330 mg & oral & Codeine & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}

I am a 17 year old Belgian guy. I'm taking codeine for about a year now (i started with 120 mg) now i take a single dose of 300 mg. I can't stay off it for longer than three weeks. I know i've fucked up my life seriously (considering i'm `only' 17), not about the codeine, but I know what opiates can do, and I'm sure that i will try them again whenever i'm in big problems\ldots  that's the only truth. My life is 50\% codeine and 50\% of the rest. I take two SSRI's for a severe depression. I get very scared when I'm thinking of what i'm doing at my age.



I'm now withdrawing (for the seventh time or so) day four, so my worst day is over. I'm sure I want things to change

i really hope they do\ldots 



The most important thing i can say to you: when you are not feeling well, don't take codeine! You will spread out your problems over your whole life! 



I'm not saying codeine is bad or so, you really really have to know what you're doing, and i don't\ldots  





Alberto

\end{document}
